SEARCH
Package controller.utils

Class InputScanner

Object
InputScanner
public class InputScanner extends Object
Utility class for handling user input. This class provides methods to prompt the user for various types of input.
Since:
25/11/23
Version:
1.0
Author:
SCSZ Group 4

  • Method Details

    • promptForInt

      public static int promptForInt(String prompt)
      Prompts the user for an integer input.
      Parameters:
      prompt - - The prompt message to display to the user.
      Returns:
      integer - The integer entered by the user.

    • promptForDate

      public static LocalDate promptForDate(String prompt, int filter)
      Prompts the user for a date input.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      filter - An integer flag to determine the filtering behavior.
      Returns:
      The LocalDate object entered by the user as a date.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the entered date has already passed (when filter is 0).
      DateTimeException - If the entered date does not exist in the calendar.
      NumberFormatException - If non-numeric values are entered for the date.
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the date is not entered in the specified format.
      InputMismatchException - If an invalid input is provided for the date.

    • promptForStartDate

      public static LocalDate promptForStartDate(String prompt)
      Prompts the user for a start date input.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      Returns:
      The LocalDate object entered by the user as a start date.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the entered date has already passed or is less than 2 days after the current date.
      DateTimeException - If the entered date does not exist in the calendar.
      NumberFormatException - If non-numeric values are entered for the date.
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the date is not entered in the specified format.
      InputMismatchException - If an invalid input is provided for the date.

    • promptForEndDate

      public static LocalDate promptForEndDate(String prompt, LocalDate startdate)
      Prompts the user for an end date input relative to a start date.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      startdate - The start date used as a reference for the end date.
      Returns:
      The LocalDate object entered by the user as the end date.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the entered date has already passed, is before the start date, or matches the start date.
      DateTimeException - If the entered date does not exist in the calendar.
      NumberFormatException - If non-numeric values are entered for the date.
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the date is not entered in the specified format.
      InputMismatchException - If an invalid input is provided for the date.

    • promptForCloseDate

      public static LocalDate promptForCloseDate(String prompt, LocalDate startdate)
      Prompts the user for a close date input relative to a start date.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to display to the user.
      startdate - The start date used as a reference for the close date.
      Returns:
      The LocalDate object entered by the user as the close date.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the entered date has already passed, is after the start date, or matches the start date.
      DateTimeException - If the entered date does not exist in the calendar.
      NumberFormatException - If non-numeric values are entered for the date.
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the date is not entered in the specified format.
      InputMismatchException - If an invalid input is provided for the date.

    • promptForString

      public static String promptForString(String prompt)
      Prompts the user for a string input.
      Parameters:
      prompt - - The prompt message to display to the user.
      Returns:
      String - The string entered by the user.

    • clear

      public static void clear()
      Clears the input buffer.
